radiographic_examinations.findings: A left-sided PICC line has been repositioned and now terminates in the mid to upper superior vena cava. The heart is normal in size. The mediastinal and hilar contours are unremarkable. Aside from multifocal thin linear opacities suggesting minor multifocal atelectasis, most extensive in the medial right lower lobe, the lungs appear clear. There is a small pleural effusion on the left. A partly visualized drain is seen in the right upper quadrant. There is no pneumothorax.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repositioning of the left-sided PICC line noted; comparison made to earlier in the same day.
